name: Alhambra
description: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Spain.
quote: Everything here appears calculated to inspire kind and happy feelings, for everything is delicate and beautiful.

name: Petra
description: An ancient city carved into rose-colored rock faces.
quote: A rose-red city half as old as time.

name: Angkor Wat
description: The largest religious monument in the world.
quote: The temple is like no other building in the world. It has towers and decoration and all the refinements which the human genius can conceive of.

name: Colosseum
description: An oval amphitheatre in Rome.
quote: He who saw the Colosseum, saw Rome.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: A symbol of freedom in New York Harbor.
quote: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.

name: Mount Everest
description: Earth's highest mountain above sea level.
quote: It's not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: The highest mountain in Africa.
quote: The summit of Kilimanjaro is a craterous rim of a volcano. I reached there at noon, and waited on the highest point until the clouds lifted.

name: Machu Picchu
description: A 15th-century Inca citadel set high in the Andes Mountains.
quote: Few romances can ever surpass that of the granite citadel on top of the beetling precipices of Machu Picchu.

name: Taj Mahal
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum.
quote: Not a piece of architecture, as other buildings are, but the proud passion of an emperor's love wrought in living stones.

name: Galapagos Islands
description: A volcanic archipelago in the Pacific Ocean.
quote: The natural history of these islands is eminently curious, and well deserves attention.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: A wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris.
quote: I ought to be jealous of the tower. She is more famous than I am.

name: Chichen Itza
description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people.
quote: The ancient Maya observed the movements of the sun, moon, and planets, and based their calendar on these observations.

name: Great Library of Alexandria
description: One of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world.
quote: The Library was the first occasion where a large concentration of scholars had been brought together under one roof.

name: Hanging Gardens of Babylon
description: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: The Hanging Gardens have plants cultivated above ground level, and the roots of the trees are embedded in an upper terrace rather than in the earth.

name: Cristo Redentor
description: Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
quote: Christ the Redeemer, with open arms, is always ready to receive and embrace anyone who comes to Him.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications built along the historical northern borders of China.
quote: The Great Wall of China is a monument to human ingenuity and indefatigability; it's also a monument to human folly.

name: Yosemite Valley
description: A glacial valley in California's Sierra Nevada mountains.
quote: It is by far the grandest of all the special temples of Nature I was ever permitted to enter.

name: Forbidden City
description: A palace complex in central Beijing, China.
quote: Out of this door might come a princess in a dress of golden silk, embroidered with dragons, or a band of swordsmen in leather coats and iron helmets.

quote: Everything here appears calculated to inspire kind and happy feelings, for everything is delicate and beautiful.

quote: The ancient Maya observed the movements of the sun, moon, and planets, and based their calendar on these observations.

name: Great Library of Alexandria
description: One of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world.
quote: The Library was the first occasion where a large concentration of scholars had been brought together under one roof.

name: Hanging Gardens of Babylon
description: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: The Hanging Gardens have plants cultivated above ground level, and the roots of the trees are embedded in an upper terrace rather than in the earth.

name: Cristo Redentor
description: Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
quote: Christ the Redeemer, with open arms, is always ready to receive and embrace anyone who comes to Him.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications built along the historical northern borders of China.
quote: The Great Wall of China is a monument to human ingenuity and indefatigability; it's also a monument to human folly.

name: Yosemite Valley
description: A glacial valley in California's Sierra Nevada mountains.
quote: It is by far the grandest of all the special temples of Nature I was ever permitted to enter.

name: Forbidden City
description: A palace complex in central Beijing, China.
quote: Out of this door might come a princess in a dress of golden silk, embroidered with dragons, or a band of swordsmen in leather coats and iron helmets.

name: Pyramids
description: The oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: O, let not the pains of death which come upon thee enter into my body. I am the god Tem, and I am in the foremost part of the sky, and the power which protecteth me is that which is with all the gods forever.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England.
quote: Time crumbles things; everything grows old and is forgotten under the power of time.

name: Oracle
description: A sacred site in ancient Greece used for the worship of Apollo.
quote: The ancient Oracle said that I was the wisest of all the Greeks. It is because I alone, of all the Greeks, know that I know nothing.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A former cathedral and mosque in Istanbul.
quote: I have surpassed thee, O Solomon!

name: Notre Dame
description: A medieval Catholic cathedral in Paris.
quote: Architecture has recorded the great ideas of the human race. Not only every religious symbol, but every human thought has its page in that vast book.

name: Broadway
description: A theater district in New York City.
quote: Give my regards to Broadway, remember me to Herald Square. Tell all the gang at Forty-Second Street, that I will soon be there.

name: Porcelain Tower
description: A pagoda in Nanjing, China, built during the Ming Dynasty.
quote: It is the most beautiful porcelain tower of which we have heard tell in the whole world.

name: Hubble Space Telescope
description: A space telescope that was launched into low Earth orbit in 1990.
quote: The important achievement of Apollo was demonstrating that humanity is not forever chained to this planet and our visions go rather further than that and our opportunities are unlimited.

name: CN Tower
description: A concrete communications and observation tower in Toronto.
quote: The CN Tower is the tallest metal structure on earth. This is assuming you don't count the Trojan horse.

name: Paititi
description: A legendary lost Incan city of gold.
quote: We have before us a quest to find the lost city of Paititi, the golden city that was rumored to exist somewhere in the dense jungles east of the Andes.

name: Matterhorn
description: A mountain in the Alps straddling the border between Switzerland and Italy.
quote: One can't describe the Matterhorn, one can only look at it in wonder.

name: Chocolate Hills
description: Geological formations in Bohol, Philippines.
quote: These perfectly cone-shaped hills, like giant mole hills, are one of nature's wonders, though no one can explain how they were formed.

name: Giant's Causeway
description: An area of about 40,000 interlocking basalt columns in Northern Ireland.
quote: The place where Finn McCool's causeway ends and the natural world begins is impossible to determine.

name: Amundsen-Scott Research Station
description: A United States scientific research station at the South Pole.
quote: The land here is unlike anything else. It's the closest I've ever come to being on another planet.

name: Bermuda Triangle
description: A region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean where ships and aircraft are said to mysteriously disappear.
quote: The Bermuda Triangle is a very strange place. Strange things happen out there that can't be explained.

name: Tower of Pisa
description: A freestanding bell tower known for its unintended tilt.
quote: The Leaning Tower of Pisa would be just another old tower if it stood up straight.

name: Sahara el Beyda
description: A natural protectorate in Egypt with white chalk rock formations.
quote: One wonders at the forces of nature that created this alien landscape, so different from the rolling sand dunes of classic deserts.

name: Bolshoi Theatre
description: A historic theatre in Moscow, Russia.
quote: Art is not a luxury, but a necessity.

name: Estadio do Maracanã
description: A football stadium in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
quote: Soccer isn't the same as Bach or Buddhism. But it is often more deeply felt than religion, and just as much a part of the community's fabric, a repository of traditions.

name: Arecibo Observatory
description: A radio telescope in Puerto Rico that was the largest single-aperture telescope until 2016.
quote: The Arecibo message and all we do to reach across the heavens is our way of saying we are still here, we are still searching. And we still hope.

name: Ethnographic Museum
description: A museum showcasing different cultures across the world.
quote: Memory is not just remembering the past, it is how we understand ourselves in the present.

name: Biosphere
description: A sealed artificial environment built to study ecological systems.
quote: The biosphere does not belong to us; we belong to the biosphere.

name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: A suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate strait in San Francisco.
quote: What a monument to the builders of our country—what a monument to their vision.

name: Venetian Arsenal
description: A complex of shipyards and armories in Venice.
quote: Let the whole area be occupied by workshops and factories for everything useful to naval matters.

name: Kilwa Kisiwani
description: A historical settlement on an island off the coast of Tanzania.
quote: Kilwa becomes the most beautiful and well-constructed city in the whole world, where most houses are built of coral stone.

name: University of Sankore
description: A significant educational center in Timbuktu during the Mali Empire.
quote: When a scholar dies in Africa, it is as if a library has burnt down.

name: St. Basil's Cathedral
description: A church in Red Square in Moscow, Russia.
quote: I have never seen a more beautiful architectural work on earth. Indeed, it is something that must be seen to be appreciated.

name: Jebel Barkal
description: A small mountain in Sudan considered sacred by ancient Egyptians and Nubians.
quote: This pure mountain... whose primeval stone was there from the beginning... the throne of Re... which Amun made his seat.

name: Panama Canal
description: A waterway connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans through Panama.
quote: The canal is an expression of that old and valid idea that the man who could make two blades of grass grow where one had grown before was a benefactor to mankind.

name: Mont St. Michel
description: A tidal island with a medieval monastery in Normandy, France.
quote: The wonder of the Western World, a Gothic-style Benedictine abbey dedicated to the archangel St. Michael.

name: Delicate Arch
description: A freestanding natural arch located in Utah, USA.
quote: The arch has an undeniable splendor that comes not just from its position against the sky, but from its size, symmetry, and distinctive shape.

name: Temple of Artemis
description: A Greek temple dedicated to the goddess Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: I have seen the walls and Hanging Gardens of ancient Babylon, the statue of Olympian Zeus, the Colossus of Rhodes, the mighty work of the high Pyramids and the tomb of Mausolus. But when I saw the temple at Ephesus rising to the clouds, all these other wonders were put in the shade.

name: Statue of Zeus
description: A giant seated figure of Zeus, the king of the Greek gods, at Olympia.
quote: ...nor has anyone who has seen that statue ever been able to form a mental image that departs from that impression.

name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
description: A tomb built for Mausolus, a satrap in the Persian Empire.
quote: From the must of the mausoleum, the stone lions stare with unflinching eyes.

name: Kremlin
description: A fortified complex in the center of Moscow.
quote: The Kremlin is the heart of Moscow, the heart of Russia. And therein lies its timelessness and its magic.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang.
quote: The Terracotta Army was an astonishing and precious archaeological discovery - life-sized ancient works of art that speak to us across the centuries.

name: Moai
description: Monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island.
quote: The statues walked. Two hundred men could move them over a mile a day.

name: Global Seed Vault
description: A secure seed bank on the Norwegian island of Spitsbergen.
quote: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault is the Noah's Ark for biodiversity of crops—a place where we keep safe for humanity the diversity of the crops that feed us.

name: Rock of Gibraltar
description: A monolithic limestone promontory in Gibraltar.
quote: The ancient Pillars of Hercules, one of which is Gibraltar, were thought to mark the end of the known world.

name: Statue Garden
description: An outdoor garden dedicated to the exhibition of sculptures.
quote: Art is not a mirror held up to reality, but a hammer with which to shape it.

name: Great Lighthouse
description: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, a lighthouse built in Alexandria, Egypt.
quote: The stars serve as eternal and distinctive beacons, guiding ships to safe harbor.
